episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a bizarre chess cheating accusation involving yogurt, the many imitators of Harry Houdini, a Finnish prison where gates are locked to keep tourists out, and Hawaii's annual Spam festival.

facts.fact: In 1978, chess player Victor Kochnoy accused Anatoly Karpov of cheating using an elaborate yoghurt based code.
Imitators of Harry Houdini included Howdyny, Boudini, Houdini, Houdini, Houdini, Houdini, Bernadie and cunning the jailbreaker.
When the gates at Surman Lena Prison in Finland are locked, it's to keep tourists out, not to keep prisoners in.
One of Hawaii's biggest annual festivals is devoted entirely to spam.
